list.name: Default
list.comment: Started to add the data pipelining for battle scenes. Currently the game starts in a debug mode with two players facing off some squirtle, which I will shortly fix.

task.summary: First commit. We have a working implementation of pokemons movement system, modulo a working tile and background rendered. This will be implemented next, followed by NPC AI and the first route.
Fixed up the houses, but the bottom is still cutting. Added a tileable background entity which provides a nice efficient bounding forest.
Added collision detection, added animation for the flowers, added nice overlaps so the player can move behind houses. Pallet town is looking good externally.

Moved around code into respective packages, added some new trigger entities and depth based rendering for future grass animations and doors. Moved out core game code into a GameWorld class for portability later, architected a few things differently for future networking prospects.
Added sprites for all the pallet town houses, fixed up some null pointer issues with the map triggers. Implemented the first floor of the heros house in pallet town.

Added a whole lot more code, and another floor to the hero's house. Npcs now have a basic wandering AI. Entities now have tunable collision boxes, so the player cannot wander into an NPC for instance.
Added a rudimentary dialogue state. Got TTF pokemon fonts working, which was a bit of a pain. Not much in the way of slick documentation on it.
Moved some entities into wrappers for convenience - added a dialogue wrapper for the ability to get dialogues from objects. Did some code maintenance in World and other places that I forget.
Polished up the text dialogue mechanics. Fits the old pokemon style nicely now.
Polished some grass entity related things, added a partial rendering wrapper which allows for entities only to render when they are close to an NPC.
Added a clone method to entities so that they can be passed as reference objects to decorators.
Fixed up the route one sprite, fixed a bunch of errors in the entity decorators. As a result, the grass sprites now work as expected.

MESSAGE.value: First commit. We have a working implementation of pokemons movement system, modulo a working tile and background rendered. This will be implemented next, followed by NPC AI and the first route.
Fixed up the houses, but the bottom is still cutting. Added a tileable background entity which provides a nice efficient bounding forest.
Added collision detection, added animation for the flowers, added nice overlaps so the player can move behind houses. Pallet town is looking good externally.

Moved around code into respective packages, added some new trigger entities and depth based rendering for future grass animations and doors. Moved out core game code into a GameWorld class for portability later, architected a few things differently for future networking prospects.
Added sprites for all the pallet town houses, fixed up some null pointer issues with the map triggers. Implemented the first floor of the heros house in pallet town.

Added a whole lot more code, and another floor to the hero's house. Npcs now have a basic wandering AI. Entities now have tunable collision boxes, so the player cannot wander into an NPC for instance.
Added a rudimentary dialogue state. Got TTF pokemon fonts working, which was a bit of a pain. Not much in the way of slick documentation on it.
Moved some entities into wrappers for convenience - added a dialogue wrapper for the ability to get dialogues from objects. Did some code maintenance in World and other places that I forget.
Polished up the text dialogue mechanics. Fits the old pokemon style nicely now.
Polished some grass entity related things, added a partial rendering wrapper which allows for entities only to render when they are close to an NPC.
Added a clone method to entities so that they can be passed as reference objects to decorators.
Fixed up the route one sprite, fixed a bunch of errors in the entity decorators. As a result, the grass sprites now work as expected.
Started to add the data pipelining for battle scenes. Currently the game starts in a debug mode with two players facing off some squirtle, which I will shortly fix.
